tajweed_content_desc: The science of tajweed is the knowledge used to understand the rules and methods of reciting (pronouncing) the letters of the Qur'an correctly and beautifully. Its purpose is to preserve the recitation of the Qur'an from errors and changes, as well as to safeguard the mouth from reading mistakes. Studying the science of tajweed is a communal obligation (Fardlu Kifayah), while reciting the Qur'an correctly according to the rules of tajweed is an individual obligation (Fardlu 'Ain).
examples: Examples:

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar/Idzhar Halqi tajweed law happens when a nun sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idzhar (ا ع غ ح خ ها), it is pronounced clearly and distinctly.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letters of idzhar are pronounced clearly because their point of articulation is the mouth and they are in the throat.
examples: مِنْ آَلِ فِرْعَوْنَ  Nun sakinah meets أ
فَكُلُوا مِنْهَا حَيْثُ Nun sakinah meets هـ
بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ Nun sakinah meets ع
مِنْ غَفُورٍ رَحِيم Nun sakinah meets غ
أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ Tanween meets ح
كُونُوا قِرَدَةً خَاسِئِينَ Tanween meets خ

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Bigunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Bigunnah tajweed law happens when a nun sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idgham bigunnah (ي ن م و), it is pronounced with a nasal sound.
tajweed_laws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bigunnah means nasal sound. So the letters of idgham bigunnah are pronounced with a nasal sound.
examples: مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَتَمَاسَّا Nun sakinah meets ي
إِلَّا سَاعَةً مِنْ نَهَارٍ Nun sakinah meets ن
وَأَنْفِقُوا مِنْ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ Nun sakinah meets م
مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ وَالٍ Nun sakinah meets و
بِبُهْتَانٍ يَفْتَرِينَهُ Tanween meets ي
حِطَّةٌ نَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ Tanween meets ن
رَقَبَةٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ Tanween meets م
مِنْ خَيْلٍ وَلَا رِكَابٍ Tanween meets و

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Bilagunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Bilagunnah tajweed law happens when a nun sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idgham bilagunnah (ل ر), it is pronounced by merging without nasal sound.
tajweed_laws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bilagunnah means without nasal sound. So the letters of idgham bilagunnah are pronounced by merging without a nasal sound.
examples: فَضْلًا مِنْ رَبِّكَ Nun sakinah meets ر
قَالَ لَمْ أَكُنْ لِأَسْجُدَ Nun sakinah meets ل
لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ Tanween meets ل
سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَاثَةٌ رَابِعُهُمْ Tanween meets ر

tajweed_laws.name: Iqlab
tajweed_laws.summary: Iqlab tajweed law happens when a nun sakinah or tanween meets the letter of iqlab (ب), it is pronounced by replacing it with the letter mim.
tajweed_laws.detail: Iqlab means to merge or, in simpler terms, to replace the letter with the letter mim.
examples: أَنْ تُنْبِتُوا Nun sakinah meets ب
كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا Tanween meets ب

tajweed_laws.name: Ikhfa
tajweed_laws.summary: Ikhfa/Ikhfa Haqiqi tajweed law happens when a nun sakinah or tanween meets the letters of ikhfa haqiqi (ت ث ج د ذ ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ف ق ك), it is pronounced softly.
tajweed_laws.detail: Ikhfa means to conceal or hide, while haqiqi means real or true. So the letters of ikhfa haqiqi are pronounced softly.
examples: أَنْتُمْ Nun sakinah meets ت
مَنْثُورًا Nun sakinah meets ث
فَأَنْجَيْنَاه Nun sakinah meets ج
عِنْدَهُ Nun sakinah meets د
لِيُنْذِرَكُمْ Nun sakinah meets ذ
أُنْزِلَ Nun sakinah meets ز
نَنْسَخْ Nun sakinah meets س
مَنْشُورً Nun sakinah meets ش
رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا Tanween meets ص
وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا Tanween meets ض
صَعِيدًا طَيِّبًا Tanween meets ط
ظِلًّا ظَلِيلً Tanween meets ظ
سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ Tanween meets ف
عَلِيمٌ قَدِيرٌ Tanween meets ق
وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ Tanween meets ك

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar Syafawy
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar Syafawy tajweed law happens when a mim sakinah meets the letters of idzhar shafawy (ا ت ث ج ح خ د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ع غ ف ق ك ل ن و ه ي), it must be pronounced clearly even with closed lips.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letters of idzhar shafawy are so many, except for mim and ba, because the two letters are owned by ikhfa shafawy and idgham mimi.
examples: أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَم Mim sakinah meets ا
أَنْعَمْتَ Mim sakinah meets ت
ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ Mim sakinah meets ث
أَنَّ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ Mim sakinah meets ج
يَمْحَقُ اللَّهُ الرِّبَا Mim sakinah meets ح

tajweed_laws.name: Ikhfa Syafawy
tajweed_laws.summary: Ikhfa Syafawy tajweed law happens when a mim sakinah meets the letters of ikhfa shafawy (ب), it is pronounced softly by disguising the sound with a nasal tone.
tajweed_laws.detail: Although the nasal sound isn't very clear because the letters Mim Sukun and Ba have the same exit point, namely two lips. There is only one letter for Ikhfa Syafawy. The letters are the same as iqlab, but the way to read them is not merged like iqlab.
examples: وَمَا هُمْ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ Mim sakinah meets the letter of ب
وَهُمْ بِالْآَخِرَةِ Mim sakinah meets the letter of ب
عَلَيْهِمْ بِعِلْمٍ Mim sakinah meets the letter of ب

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mimi
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mimi tajweed law happens when mim sakinah meets the letters of idgham mimi (م), it is pronounced in the same way as mim shaddah.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letter of Idgham Mimi is only one. The letter is mim. So, Idgham Mimi is the meeting of two mim letters. The way to pronounce it is the same as pronouncing the mim with shaddah. Because, mim shaddah is a combination of mim sakinah and mim with harakah.
examples: وَكَمْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ Mim sakinah meets م
كُلَّمَا أَضَاءَ لَهُمْ مَشَوْا فِيهِ Mim sakinah meets م
إِلَيْكُمْ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ Mim sakinah meets م

tajweed_laws.name: Ghunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Ghunnah tajweed law happens if there is a shaddah on the letter mim (مّ) and nun (ن), it is pronounced with a nasal sound and is called Ghunnah.
tajweed_laws.detail: Ghunnah means: nasaling (at the bridge of the nose). So the way to read it is by humming the letters mim and nun taysdid on the bridge of the nose for 2 - 3 harakah.
examples: امَّةٌ Mim Shaddah
النَّارِ Nun Shaddah
أمَنَّا Nun Shaddah
الْجَنَّةُ Nun Shaddah

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutamasilain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutamasilain tajweed law happens when a letter meets a similar letter, with the same makhraj and characteristic, where the first letter is sukun (silent) and the second letter has a harakah.
tajweed_laws.detail:
The way to read it is by inserting the first sukun letter into the second harokah letter. And being pressured, he was detained for no more than one harokah.
The rule of Idgham Mutamasilain has exceptions. If the letter Wawu with sukun meets the letter (و) or if the letter Ya' with sukun meets the letter (ي), then it should not be pronounced with Idgham (merging) into the second letter, but it should be read with a long pronunciation or MAD as it is supposed to be. An additional exception is that if the letter before the Wawu (و) or Ya (ي) has a fathah harakat, then Idgham can be applied (https://www.khudzilkitab.com/2019/01/idgham-mutamatsilain-lengkap.html).
examples: فَلْيَكْتُبْ بَيْنَكُمْ Ba sakinah meets ب
طَلَعَتْ تَزَاوَرُ Ta sakinah meets ت
وَقَدْ دَخَلُوا Da sakinah meets د
إِذْ ذَهَبَ Dza sakinah meets ذ
يُدْرِكُكُمْ Ka sakinah meets ك
الَمْ أَقُلْ لَكَ Lam sakinah meets ل
َأَنْتُمْ مُسْلِمُوْنَ Mim sakinah meets م
مِنْ نَفْعِهِمَا Nun sakinah meets ن

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutajaanisain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutajaanisain tajweed law happens if there is a letter with the meaning of sukun opposite a letter with the meaning of harakah, both have the same makhroj but have different characteristics.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is by inserting or idghom the first letter in the second letter.
examples: إِذْ مَمَّتْ طَائِفَتْنِ Ta sakinah meets ط
اثْقَلَتْ دَعَوَا اللهَ Ta sakinah meets د
لَقَدْ تَابَ Da sakinah meets ت
إِذْ ظَلَمُوا Dzal sakinah meets ظ
لَئِنْ بَسَطْتَ Tho sakinah meets ت
ُلْ رَّبِّي Lam sakinah meets رَ

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutaqooribain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutaqooribain tajweed law happens if a letter with a sukun meets a letter with a harakah, the two letters are close to each other, makhroj and its properties.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is by inserting or adding the first letter to the second letter.
examples: ارْ كَيْمَعَنَا Ba sakinah meets م
َذَّبَتْ ثَمُود Ta sakinah meets ث
يَلْهَثْ ذَلِكَ Tsa sakinah meets ذ
نَخْلُقُكُمْ Qaf sakinah meets ك

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar Qamariyah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar Qamariyah tajweed law happens when a lam ta’rief meets the letters of idzhar qamariyah (ء ب ج ح خ ع غ ف ق ك م و ه ي), it must be pronounced clearly.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qamar in Arabic means moon. Meanwhile, lam ta'rief is likened to a star. This is because the stars remain visible even though they meet the moon.
examples: لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولً Alif lam meets ء
فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ Alif lam meets ب
أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ Alif lam meets ج
خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ Alif lam meets ح
وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ Alif lam meets خ

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Syamsiyah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Syamsiyah tajweed law happens when a lam ta’rief meets the letters of qamariyah, other than idzhar qamariyah (ت ث د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ل ن), it is called idgham.
tajweed_laws.detail: Syamsiyah means sun, so if Alif Lam, which is likened to a star, meets the sun, it becomes less visible. Because this is not readable, the alif lam which meets the syamsiyah letters, seems to be shaddah, or inserted into the next letter.
examples: وَأَنْزَلَ التَّوْرَاةَ Alif lam meets ت
مِنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ Alif lam meets ث
يَوْمِ الدِّينِ Alif lam meets د
وَالذَّاكِرِينَ Alif lam meets ذ
الرَّحْمَنِ Alif lam meets ر

tajweed_laws.name: Tafkhim
tajweed_laws.summary: Tafkhim tajweed law happens when there is the letter lam (ل) in the word Allah (اللّه) preceded by a letter with a Fatha or Damma vowel.
tajweed_laws.detail: It must be recited thickly or with Tafkhim, which is done by lifting the entire tongue and pressing it against the upper palate while emphasizing the sound strongly.
examples: َلَوْ شَاءَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
هَدْنَا اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
مَا شَاءَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
زِينَةَ اللهِ Fatha meets اللهُ
ذَهَبَ الله Fatha meets اللهُ
شَهِدَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
رَحْمَتَ اللهِ Fatha meets اللهُ
وَاتَّقُو الله Damma meets اللهُ
رَسُولُ اللَّهِ Damma meets اللهُ
ذُكِرَ اسْمُ اللهِ Damma meets اللهُ
ذلِكُمُ اللهُ Damma meets اللهُ
انْ لَعْنَةُ اللهِ Damma meets اللهُ
رَزَقَكُمُ اللهُ Damma meets اللهُ

tajweed_laws.name: Tarqiq
tajweed_laws.summary: Tarqiq tajweed law happens when there is the letter lam (ل) in the word Allah (اللّه) preceded by a letter with a Kasra vowel.
tajweed_laws.detail: It must be recited thinly or with Tarqiq
examples: مِنْ دُونِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
َرْضِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
رَسُولِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
بِسْمِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
عِنْدِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
وَلْيَتَّقِ الله Kasra meets اللهُ
وَجْهِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ

tajweed_laws.name: Qalqalah Sughra
tajweed_laws.summary: Qalqalah Sughra tajweed law happens if there is a silent qalqalah letter (ب ج د ط ق) in the middle of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah sughra.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qalqalah sughra is read thinner, like the meaning of sughra itself which means small.
examples: ثُمَّ لِيَقْطَعْ فَلْيَنْظُرْ There is a Qaf sakinah letter in the middle of the word
ثَانِيَ عِطْفِهِ  There is a Tho sakinah letter in the middle of the word
وَقَوْمُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ There is a Ba sakinah letter in the middle of the word
فَعَلَيَّ إِجْرَامِي There is a Ja sakinah letter in the middle of the word
يَدْعُو مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ  There is a Da sakinah letter in the meiddle of the word

tajweed_laws.name: Qalqalah Kubra
tajweed_laws.summary: Qalqalah Kubra tajweed law happens if there is a silent qalqalah letter (ب ج د ط ق) at the end of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah kubro.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qalqalah kubro, how to read it, is reflected more clearly and louder, like the meaning of kubro which means big.
examples: بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ There is a Ba letter in the end of the sentence
وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ There is a Ja letter in the end of the sentence
وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ There is a Da letter in the end of the sentence
قَائِمًا بِالْقِسْطِ There is a Tho letter in the end of the sentence
وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ There is a Qaf letter in the end of the sentence

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Thabi'i
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of reading is called Mad Thobi'i, that is, if the letter whose sound is extended is a letter with the harokat Damma (ُ) and after it there is the letter Wau Sukun (ﻭْ), a letter with the harokat kasroh and after that there is the letter Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ), a letter with the harokat fathah (َ) and after that there is the letter Alif (ا)
examples: يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ Damma meets و sukun
أَنْ تَكُونَ Damma meets و sukun
وَيَقْذِفُوْنَ Damma meets و sukun
اجُورَكُمْ Damma meets و sukun
َجْرٌ عَظِيم Kasra meets ي sukun
صدِقِينَ Kasra meets ي sukun
َأَيْتَ الْمُنْفِقِين Kasra meets ي sukun
فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets ي sukun
جَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ Fatha meets ا
فَقَدْ فَازَ Fatha meets ا
َأَمْوَالَهُم Fatha meets ا
أَمْوَالِكُمْ Fatha meets ا
مَا بِصَاحِبِكُمْ Fatha meets ا

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Wajib Muttasil
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Wajib Muttasil tajweed law happens if Mad Thobi'i meets a living Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence, it is mandatory to prolong it.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it must be extended to two and a half Alif or five harokat or two and a half times the length of Mad Thobi'i.
examples: مِنْهُ الْمَاءُ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
صَفْرَاءُ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
دُعَاءً Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
مَنْ يَشَاءُ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
فَبَاءُ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
أَحْيَاء Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
سَوَاء Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
امَنَ السُّفَهَاءُ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
شُهَدَاءَ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
وَلَوْ شَاءَ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Jaiz Munfassil
tajweed_laws.summary: The recitation rule is called Mad Jaiz Munfashil when Mad Thobi'i (ء) is in a different word.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is better to extend it like the length of Mad Wajib Muttashil, but also may be extended like the length of Mad Thobi'i.
examples: فِيهَا أَبَدًا Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
بِمَا أُنْزِلَ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
وَمَا أُنْزِلَ Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
ذُرِّيَّتِنَا أُمُّةً Mad Thobi'i meets Hamzah (ء) in different word

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Mutsaqqal Kilmi
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Lazim Mutsaqqal Kilmi tajweed law happens if Mad Thobi'i is faced with letters with shaddah within a word.
tajweed_laws.detail: The pronunciation should be prolonged first for 3 alif or 6 harakah before shaddah is added.
examples: هُمُ الضَّآلُّونَ Mad Thobi'i meets shaddah letter within a word
وَلَا الضَّآلِّينَ Mad Thobi'i meets shaddah letter within a word
إِلَّا الضَّآلُوْنَ Mad Thobi'i meets shaddah letter within a word
جَاءَتِ الطَّآمَّةُ Mad Thobi'i meets shaddah letter within a word
فِي السِّلْمِ كَآفَّةً Mad Thobi'i meets shaddah letter within a word

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Mukhaffaf Kilmi
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Lazim Mukhaffaf Kilmi tajweed law happens if Mad Thobi'i meets a sukun-harokat letter not at the end of a word. (prolonged up to three alif or six harakah).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is like Mad Lazim Mutsaqqol Kilmi (extended to three alif or six harakah).
examples: آلان only in Surah Yunus

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Layyin
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Layyin tajweed law happens if there is a Mad letter, whether it is Wau Sukun (ﻭْ) or Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ) preceded by a fathah-harokat letter.
tajweed_laws.detail: It is pronounced softly and smoothly.
examples: بِالْغَيْبِ Fatha meets يْ
عَلَيْهِ Fatha meets يْ
عَلَيْكُمْ Fatha meets يْ
إِلَيْكَ Fatha meets يْ
يَدَيْهَا Fatha meets يْ
فَتَمَنَّوُ الْمَوْتَ Fatha meets وْ
فَوْقَكُمْ Fatha meets وْ
يَوْمَ Fatha meets وْ
قَوْمًا Fatha meets وْ

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Arid Lissukun
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Arid Lissukun tajweed law happens if there is Mad Thobi'i or Mad Layyin followed by a waqf (stopping place).
tajweed_laws.detail:
There are 3 ways to read it:
a. What is more important is that it is read long, the same as Mad Wajib Mutashil (three alif or six harakah).
b. The middle (medium) one can only be read as two Alif or four harokats (twice Mad Thobi'i).
c. The sortest one may be only read as Mad Thobi'i (two harakah).
examples: ِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
ِهِمُ الْأَسْبَابُ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
مِنَ النَّارِ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَدِيدُ الْعَذَابِ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَاكِرٌ عَلِيمٌ . Mad Thobi'i in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Shilah Qashirah
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Shilah Qashirah tajweed law happens if the letter Haa Dlomir/third person pronoun (noun) comes (ه) after a vowel-harokat letter and is not connected to a sukun or shaddah letter or the letter alif.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended to one Alif or two harokat or like the length of Mad Thobi 'ii.
examples: بِهِ عِنْدَ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
وَرَسُولِهِ كُنتُمْ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
بِيَدِهِ عُقْدَةُ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
ايْتِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
جُنُودِهِ قَالُو prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
لَهُ مُلْكُ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
أَجْرُهُ عِنْدَ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
وَعَدَّدَهُ يَحْسِبُ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
وَرَحْمَتُهُ لَكُنْتُمْ prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii
ِنَّهُ هُوَ  prolong (ه) like Mad Thobi 'ii

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Shilah Thawilah
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Shilah Thawilah tajweed law happens if Mad Shilah Qoshiroh meets Hamzah (ء) preceded by a vowel-harokat letter.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is like reading Mad Jaiz Munfashil, meaning it can be extended to two and a half Alif or one Alif like Mad Thobi 'ii.
examples: أَمْرُةَٓ إِذَا prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
مِنْ دُونِهِٓ الهَةً prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
عَلَى مَوْتِهِٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
وَرَسُولُهُٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
وَأَزْوَاجُهُٓ أُمَّهْتُهُمْ prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
عِنْدَهُٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
أَنَّ مَالَهُٓ أَخْلَدَهُ prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
مِنْدُوْنِهِٓ إِلها prolong (ه) like Mad  Jaiz Munfashil
ربهِٓ أَحَدًا prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil
عِلْمِهِٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Mad Jaiz Munfashil

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Iwad
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Iwad tajweed law happens if there is fathatain vowels (ً) falling on waqf (pause), at the end of a sentence (except for ta' marbuthoh), or mentioned as a replacement for tanween so that it is no longer pronounced.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended one Alif like Mad Thobi'ii.
examples: .عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا prolong (مً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا prolong (مً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.هَجْرًا جَمِيلاً prolong (لاً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.كَانَ مِيْقَاتًا prolong (تً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا prolong (دً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.مَسْرُورًا prolong (رً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.سَبْعًا شِدَادًا prolong (دً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.نَهَا تَفْجِيرًا prolong (رً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا prolong (رً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا prolong (دً) like Mad Thobi 'ii
.ذلِكَ سَبِيلاً prolong (لاً) like Mad Thobi 'ii

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Badal
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Badal tajweed law happens if Hamzah (ء) meets Mad from a sukun-hamzah, and this hamzah is changed and replaced with Alif (ا), Wau (ﻭ).
tajweed_laws.detail: It is pronounced by prolonging it for one alif or two harakah, like Mad Thobi'ii.
examples: أُوتُوا prolong (أ) like Mad Thobi 'ii
إِيْتُونِي prolong (أ) like Mad Thobi 'ii
أَدَمُ prolong (أ) like Mad Thobi 'ii
إِيْمَانُ prolong (أ) like Mad Thobi 'ii
أَتُوا prolong (أ) like Mad Thobi 'ii

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Harfi Mukhoffaf
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Mad Lazim Harfi Mukhoffaf is when there is the beginning of a verse in the Quran that contains one or more of the letters: Haa' (ﺡ), Yaa' (ﻱ), Tho' (ط), Ha' (ه), Ro' (ر).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended one Alif like Mad Thobi'ii.
examples: حٰمٓ read HAAMIIM
يٰسٓ read YAASIIN
طٰهٰ read THOOHAA
طٰسٓ read THOOSIIN

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Harfi Mutsaqqol
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Mad Lazim Harfi Mutsaqqal is when there is the beginning of a verse in the Quran that contains one or more of the letters: Nun' (ن), Qof' (ﻕ), Shod' (ص), Ain' (ع), Sin (س), Lam (ل), Kaf (ك), and Mim (م).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to recite it must be prolonged, namely with three Alifs or six vowel counts.
examples: الٓمٓ read ALIFLAAAAAAMIIIIIIMM
الٓمٓصٓ read ALIFLAAAAAAMMIIIIIIMSHOOOOOOD
طٰسٓمٓ read THOOSIIIIIIMMIIIIIIM
الٓمٓرٰ read ALIFLAAAAAAMMIIIIIIMROO

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Musyabba'
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Mad Lazim Musyabaa' is similar to Mad Lazim Harfi Mutsaqqal, after the prolongation there is a silent letter which is not assimilated or doubled.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to recite it must be prolonged like Mad Lazim Harfi Mutsaqqal, which is with three Alifs.
examples: صٓ‌ read SHOOOOOOD
قٓ read QOOOOOOF

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Tamkin
tajweed_laws.summary: The recitation rule called Mad Tamkin occurs when there is a Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ) preceded by a Yaa' with shaddah and a Kasra vowel (ﻱِ).
tajweed_laws.detail: The reading is established with shaddah and its natural Mad is extended to the length of two vowels or one alif.
examples: وَإِذَا حُيِّيْتُمْ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
وَخَاتَمَ النَّبِيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
رَبَّانِيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
في الْأُمِّيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Farq
tajweed_laws.summary: The reading rule called Mad Farq is a Mad that in the Quran only occurs in four places.
tajweed_laws.detail: The reading must be elongated to distinguish between a question or not, so the elongation makes it clear that the sentence is in the form of a question.
examples: الأُنْثَيَيْنِ الذَّكَرَيْنِ حَرَّمَ أَما on Surah Al-An'am
قُلْ اللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُمْ on Surah Yunus
اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ on Surah An-Naml
